subject: Application for Research Position in Natural Language Processing
body:
Dear Professor Ng,

I hope this email finds you well. My name is Ruiming Kang, a Mechanical Engineering student at the University of Texas at Austin, with a strong background in software development and data analysis. I am reaching out to express my interest in your research group, as I am eager to apply my technical skills in natural language processing and machine learning.

I have substantial experience leading a team in developing responsive web applications and technical solutions tailored for events through my role as TechLead at the University of Texas Chinese Students and Scholars Association. Additionally, my student research involvement at the University of Texas at Dallas Mechanics of Advanced Materials Laboratory provided me with deep insights into data analysis and software automation, both of which could be beneficial in your ongoing projects.

I would be thrilled to further discuss how my skills can contribute to your research. Thank you for considering my application.

Best regards,

Ruiming Kang
Austin, TX | (469)-407-5201 | rkang@utexas.edu | ruimingkang.com
letter:
Dear Professor Ng,

I am writing to express my keen interest in a research position within your lab. As a current Mechanical Engineering student at the University of Texas at Austin, I have developed a robust set of technical skills, particularly in software development and data analysis, that I believe align well with your focus on natural language processing and machine learning.

My experience as a TechLead with the University of Texas Chinese Students and Scholars Association involved not only leading a team to create a responsive website but also engineering software solutions that enhanced user engagement. This experience has cultivated my ability to tackle complex software challenges and develop practical applications, skills that I am excited to apply in the realm of natural language processing.

Moreover, my role as a Student Researcher at the University of Texas at Dallas allowed me to delve into advanced data analysis techniques, utilizing MATLAB and Python for automated data processing and visualization. This work in a research setting honed my analytical skills and deepened my understanding of experimental design and methodologies, which I hope to bring to your research projects.

I am particularly drawn to your recent work on developing unsupervised machine learning techniques for language processing tasks. I am enthusiastic about the potential to contribute to this area through rigorous research collaboration.

I would greatly appreciate the opportunity to discuss my qualifications further and explore potential research opportunities within your lab. Thank you for considering my application.

Sincerely,

Ruiming Kang
Austin, TX | (469)-407-5201 | rkang@utexas.edu | ruimingkang.com
